p: Although the study revealed novel findings about SORL1, a few limitations need to be mentioned. First, the low expression level of SORL1-38b challenged the detection of this transcript in other brain regions than the cerebellum. Thus, the implementation of more sensitive techniques, as well as the optimization of established protocols, will aim at confirming our data in non-cerebellar areas. Second, the small sample size of the cerebellum cohorts limited the analysis of SORL1-38b expression in relation to the risk T/T (SNP24) genotype. Future studies including larger cohorts will help clarifying how SORL1-38b associates with SNP24.
